surge.materials.observer.guitar_taleas module¶

surge.materials.observer.patterns module¶

surge.materials.observer.tempo_map module¶

Tempi for each stage in segment.

surge.materials.observer.time_signatures module¶

There are five “stages” or cycles of 16 measures at q=54. The duration of each stage is 16/1 (or 32/2, 64/4, etc.) Each stage is subdivided into 2, 3, 4, 3, then 2 almost equal parts.

stage 1 divisions: 33/4, 31/4 stage 2 divisions: 22/4, 21/4, 21/4 stage 3 divisions: 17/4, 16/4, 17,4, 15,4 stage 4 divisions: 21/4, 21/4, 22/4 stage 5 divisions: 31/4, 33/4

Then, each stage subdivision is reconceived as a duration with a different (fractionally related) tempo.

stage 1-1: 33/4 @ q=54 (1:1) stage 1-2: 93/8 @ q=81 (2:3)

stage 2-1: 55/8 @ q=68 (4:5) stage 2-2: 21/4 @ q=54 (1:1) stage 2-3: 63/8 @ q=81 (2:3)

stage 3-1: 85/16 @ q=68 (4:5) stage 3-2: 7/1 @ q=47 (8:7) stage 3-3: 51/8 @ q=81 (2:3) stage 3-4: 7/1 @ q=72 (3:4)

stage 4-1: 21/4 @ q=54 (1:1) stage 4-2: 105/16 @ q=68 (4:5) stage 4-3: 33/8 @ q=81 (2:3)

stage 5-1: 155/16 @ q=68 (4:5) stage 5-2: 33/4 @ q=54 (1:1)

Each stage is then recursively subdivided using the same uneven bifurcation algorithm described above. The result is a list of time signatures.
